documents.content: 53-year-old female presents for follow-up of bilateral knee osteoarthritis. Patient reports chronic, stable knee pain worse with activity. No signs of infection. Vitals: Temp 98.4F, BP 128/78, HR 72. No fever. Physical exam: Bilateral knee crepitus, no warmth, no erythema, no effusion. Recent labs: WBC 6.8 (normal), no left shift. X-rays show moderate osteoarthritis both knees. Assessment: Osteoarthritis knees, stable. Plan: Continue NSAIDs, physical therapy, consider viscosupplementation. No infection present.
